The
			 term

means each of the 50 States, the District of Columbia,
			 the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, Guam,
			 American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.

text.#text:
The
			 term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a national Blue Alert communications network
			 within the

to issue Blue Alerts through the initiation,
			 facilitation, and promotion of Blue Alert plans, in coordination with States,
			 units of local government, law enforcement agencies, and other appropriate
			 entities.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall assign an
			 existing officer of the

to act as the national
			 coordinator of the Blue Alert communications network.

text.#text: The
The Coordinator shall—

establish
			 voluntary guidelines for States and units of local government to use in
			 developing Blue Alert plans that will promote compatible and integrated Blue
			 Alert plans throughout the United States, including—

a list of the
			 resources necessary to establish a Blue Alert plan;

criteria for
			 evaluating whether a situation warrants issuing a Blue Alert;

guidelines to
			 protect the privacy, dignity, independence, and autonomy of any law enforcement
			 officer who may be the subject of a Blue Alert and the family of the law
			 enforcement officer;

guidelines that a
			 Blue Alert should only be issued with respect to a law enforcement officer
			 if—

the
			 law enforcement agency involved—
confirms—

the
			 death or serious injury of the law enforcement officer; or

the
			 attack on the law enforcement officer and that there is an indication of the
			 death or serious injury of the officer; or

concludes that
			 the law enforcement officer is missing in the line of duty;

there is an
			 indication of serious injury to or death of the law enforcement officer;

the suspect
			 involved has not been apprehended; and
guidelines—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and any relevant crime information
			 repository of the State involved;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 534 of title 28, United States Code

text.#text:
that
			 information relating to a law enforcement officer who is seriously injured or
			 killed in the line of duty should be provided to the National Crime Information
			 Center database operated by the

that a Blue
			 Alert should, to the maximum extent practicable (as determined by the
			 Coordinator in consultation with law enforcement agencies of States and units
			 of local governments), be limited to the geographic areas most likely to
			 facilitate the apprehension of the suspect involved or which the suspect could
			 reasonably reach, which should not be limited to State lines;

for law
			 enforcement agencies of States or units of local government to develop plans to
			 communicate information to neighboring States to provide for seamless
			 communication of a Blue Alert; and

providing that a
			 Blue Alert should be suspended when the suspect involved is apprehended or when
			 the law enforcement agency involved determines that the Blue Alert is no longer
			 effective; and

guidelines
			 for—

the
			 issuance of Blue Alerts through the network; and

the extent of
			 the dissemination of alerts issued through the network;

develop protocols
			 for efforts to apprehend suspects that address activities during the period
			 beginning at the time of the initial notification of a law enforcement agency
			 that a suspect has not been apprehended and ending at the time of apprehension
			 of a suspect or when the law enforcement agency involved determines that the
			 Blue Alert is no longer effective, including protocols regulating—

the use of public
			 safety communications;

command center
			 operations; and

incident review,
			 evaluation, debriefing, and public information procedures;

establish an
			 advisory group to assist States, units of local government, law enforcement
			 agencies, and other entities involved in the network with initiating,
			 facilitating, and promoting Blue Alert plans, which shall include—

to the maximum
			 extent practicable, representation from the various geographic regions of the
			 United States; and

members who
			 are—

representatives
			 of a law enforcement organization representing rank-and-file officers;

representatives
			 of other law enforcement agencies and public safety communications;

broadcasters,
			 first responders, dispatchers, and radio station personnel; and

act as the
			 nationwide point of contact for—

the development
			 of the network; and

regional
			 coordination of Blue Alerts through the network; and
determine—

what procedures
			 and practices are in use for notifying law enforcement and the public when a
			 law enforcement officer is killed or seriously injured in the line of duty;
			 and

which of the
			 procedures and practices are effective and that do not require the expenditure
			 of additional resources to implement.
The guidelines established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, to the maximum extent practicable (as determined by the Coordinator in
			 consultation with law enforcement agencies of States and units of local
			 government), provide that appropriate information relating to a Blue Alert is
			 disseminated to the appropriate officials of law enforcement agencies, public
			 health agencies, and other agencies.

text.#text: The guidelines established under
The guidelines established under

provide
			 mechanisms that ensure that Blue Alerts comply with all applicable Federal,
			 State, and local privacy laws and regulations; and

include standards
			 that specifically provide for the protection of the civil liberties, including
			 the privacy, of law enforcement officers who are seriously injured or killed in
			 the line of duty and the families of the officers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chairman of the
			 Federal Communications Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in carrying out activities under this Act.

text.#text: The Coordinator shall cooperate with the
The Coordinator may not—

host a conference
			 focused solely on the Blue Alert program that requires the expenditure of
			 Federal funds.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the activities
			 of the Coordinator and the effectiveness and status of the Blue Alert plans
			 that are in effect or being developed.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually
			 thereafter, the Coordinator shall submit to

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To encourage, enhance, and integrate Blue Alert plans
		  throughout the United States in order to disseminate information when a law
		  enforcement officer is seriously injured or killed in the line of
		  duty.
